Utterance: <synch>
Hi again! It’s great to see you. How have you been since our last session?
I've been doing alright, thanks for asking. A bit busy with work, but managing.
That’s good to hear. You mentioned you were working on several projects. How has that been going?
It's been a bit overwhelming at times, but I’ve been trying to stay organized.
Staying organized can definitely help reduce stress. Have you been able to implement any of the strategies we discussed last time?
Yes, I’ve been using a planner to keep track of everything. It helps to see things laid out.
That’s a great start! How does it feel to have that visual representation of your tasks?
It feels relieving, actually. I can prioritize better and it makes everything seem less daunting.
Fantastic! Have you noticed any changes in your stress levels since you started using the planner?
I think my stress has decreased a little. I feel more in control.
That’s encouraging! You also mentioned that you find happiness in small moments. Have you had any memorable moments lately?
Yes, I went hiking last weekend and the view was breathtaking. It reminded me why I love being outdoors.
That sounds wonderful! How did that experience impact your mood?
It lifted my spirits. I felt so connected to nature, and it was a much-needed break from my routine.
Nature can be really grounding. Have you considered making that a regular part of your routine?
I’d like to! I think it would help me recharge.
That’s a great idea. It’s important to take time for yourself. How about your family? How are your relationships with them?
They’re pretty good. I’ve been trying to communicate more openly with my siblings.
That’s a positive step. How has that been going for you?
It’s been a little challenging, but I think they appreciate my effort. We had a good talk last week.
That’s wonderful progress! Open communication can really strengthen relationships. Did you find any specific strategies helpful during that conversation?
I just tried to listen more and not jump to conclusions. It helped to validate their feelings.
Excellent approach! Listening is a powerful tool. Have you noticed any changes in how they respond to you since you’ve been more open?
Yes, they seem more willing to share their thoughts with me. It feels good.
That’s great to hear! Building that trust can lead to deeper connections. Are there any other areas in your life where you’d like to focus on?
I think I’d like to work on my self-care routine. I tend to neglect it when I’m busy.
Self-care is essential, especially when you’re juggling multiple responsibilities. What does self-care look like for you?
It usually involves reading, going for walks, and sometimes just taking a moment to breathe.
Those are all wonderful activities. How often do you find time for those?
Not as often as I’d like. I often push them aside for work.
It’s easy to do that. How about setting a specific time each week dedicated to self-care?
That could work! Maybe I can schedule it like an appointment.
Exactly! Treating it as a priority can help you stick to it. What day do you think would work best for you?
I think Sundays would be ideal. It’s a good way to recharge for the week ahead.
That sounds perfect! How do you plan to spend your self-care Sundays?
I’d like to go for a hike, read a book, and just relax without any distractions.
That sounds like a lovely plan. I encourage you to stick to it and see how it impacts your overall well-being.
I will! I’m excited to try it out.
Great! Let’s check in on that next session. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that covers it for now. I feel good about our conversation.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, it’s important to celebrate the small victories. I look forward to hearing about your self-care journey next time.
Thank you, Ellie. See you next time!
Bye for now!
